fields.description:
Run instance churn test for some time and remove/add hosts. 
Execute euca-describe-nodes. The output have all instance that were ever running on this cloud. CLC/CC restart does not fix the problem.
The euca-describe-nodes also reports nodes that were enabled at some point in the system even if they are currently removed from the system.
At the same time the euca-describe-instances reports instances that were terminated several days ago.
fields.summary: euca-describe-nodes shows all instances/nodes that were ever in the cloud

comments.body: [~viglesias] would you please verify if this bug still exists in 3.3.1 or 3.4

The setup I had trapped with this ended up being 3.4.0, instead of 3.3.1 like I intended due to my misorchestration of some scripts. I am restarting the same test now on 3.3.1 and should have results tomorrow.

It appears that this is not an issue in 3.3.1 (note there is currently churn on this setup so I expect things to be just slightly off):

[root@b-25 ~]# euca-describe-instances | grep INST | grep -v term | wc -l
20
[root@b-25 ~]# euca-describe-nodes | grep INST | wc -l
22
[root@b-25 ~]#
Likely fixed due to changes for EUCA-7079.
This may be fixed by changes for EUCA-7079
Verified in latest build.
Instance data being left in the DB could occur for various reasons. This issue should only be reopened if it can be reproduced as per the original description.
[~viglesias], please file another ticket for this.
[~viglesias] Can you provide the exact steps used to reproduce this issue.

Howdy [~mmunn1] 

It was:

1) Register 2 nodes
2) Run instances on both nodes
3) Terminate all instances
4) Deregister one of the nodes
5) Node will still appear in euca-describe-nodes

I am not seeing the described behavior in the Testing Branch of 4.0 , Using Vics suggested repo method I see:
1) Deregistered NC going into NOTREADY state (this does take a few minutes)
2) The deregistered ip is immediately remove from eucalyptus.conf
3) no new instances are created on the deregistered node using euca-run-instances.
4) I am not seeing any leftover terminated instances?

Is the desired behavior of this bug that the deregistered node information not show up in euca-describe-nodes at all?

[~mmunn1]

Correct. After nodes are deregistered they should no longer appear in euca-describe-nodes.
This should probably also be tested with a large number of nodes (i.e 30+), since this *seems* to exacerbate the problem.

[~decker]   I am really stuck on this one.

There are 2 issues here:

1) If there is only one registered node and you try and deregister it, then in Nodes.updateNodeInfo(...)
   the unreportedTags is always an empty set, so it will not even attempt destroying the node, 
   and will not even be set to NOTREADY
   
2) If you have two registered nodes and then deregister one, then there will be one unreportedTag
   and the removal code will be executed,  but the node is not actually removed using the code provided
   with your groovy script, it is just set to NOTREADY. It does in fact execute the code in component.destroy( ncConfig )
   but the node remains in the describe-services output
   
Questions:

1) Where is the node list that is passed into updateNodeInfo( ServiceConfiguration ccConfig, List<NodeType> nodes )
   modified by euca_conf --deregister-node?

2) Is  updateNodeInfo(...) really where we want to call component.destroy( ncConfig ); 
   or do we want to call it before the node list in question 1 is modified by --deregister-node?

Code Review Request : EUCA-7151 euca-describe-nodes shows all instances/nodes that were ever in the cloud

branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-7151

diff :  git show --color e7e99abda32af2c2e6cf8993a0b0d4791825412b


Summary:  Deregister is not working correctly for all services. The service would get de-registered
and then immediately get re-registered in Topolgy.java ServiceConfiguration apply( final ServiceConfiguration input ) 
which is run by RunChecks.INSTANCE.call() every 20 seconds. 

Solution: remove the omponents.lookup( input.getComponentId( ) ).setup( input ); call in 
Topolgy.java ServiceConfiguration apply( final ServiceConfiguration input )  so the service in not re-registered

Unit test : 
run euca_conf --deregister-cluster and the node sahould be removed from euca-describe-nodes output. 

Thx Mike
[~mmunn1], can you update here w/ the solution you arrive at in the end?

Final Fix:
branch : dev/mmunn1/EUCA-7151
git show a5a42e330311d1f4928c82974c84708298259ec2

Test output for euca-sequence-4.0
http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=mmunn-dist-system&uid=1002&prev_page=&Refresh=Refresh

Everything is working fine and I can launch instances but I am confused why the CLC is logging such a message saying it failed to find cluster controller.

I am using following packages on the CLC

{code}
eucalyptus-4.0.0-0.0.958.20140430git93d59a3e.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-4.0.0-0.0.958.20140430git93d59a3e.el6.x86_64

Are you seeing this only when you deregister nodes, or are you seeing this about every 20 seconds?

[~dshekhawat] Yes I am seeing this too, everything appears to be working correctly but I am seeing the error every 20 seconds when the nodeinfo is updated, I will take a closer look tomorrow.  Thanks!
removed un-needed call to nodesToUpdate.add(nodeInfo) to reduce debug logging in previous commit
I don't see this issue anymore.
